1 photograph: color; 13x9cm. Tambopata National Reserve, Peru. Note: "High, eroding banks, mudflats barren islands, islands
                                 with vegetation, fallen trees. The Tambopata is not as large as the Napo or the Amazon - at least it wasn't between Puerto
                                 Maldonado + Explorer's Inn. For that distance however, the banks and islands of the T.P. were more varied + interesting than
                                 what I saw on the Napo + Amazon. (No livable islands.)"

Title: -----. Photo album: postcard: Weaver.
Notes:
1 postcard: color; 15x11cm. Cuzco, Peru. Note: folio 14, upper. "Plaze de Armas - Main Square + Jesuit Church, Cuzco - a
                                 lovely place to sit and people watch. Sellers of food and drink, clothing and souvenirs abound. There are also shoe-shiners,
                                 and a few beggars, business people and the elderly. I felt surprisingly at home."

Title: Butler, Octavia E. Photo album: llama.
Notes:
1 postcard: color; 15x11cm. Cuzco, Peru. Note: folio 14 verso, upper. "On one side of the Plaza, a patio on which book sellers
                                 spread their wares. Indian women with high hats wrapped by colorful ribbons and babies wrapped in shawls sell food on corners.
                                 Children + women walk about offering sandwiches, cups of juice for sale. The children should be in school, but they are obviously
                                 very poor. Alpaca jackets, rugs, and stuffed animals are offered. One says ‘No' without looking after a while."
